channel.title: Starting New Project Help:)
channel.description:
Hello,
I am starting a complete clean 317 server and going to upgrade it and really try to learn the code, not like others that don't know jack crap about the code. I have been gone for awhile so sorry if i ask some "stupid" questions.:)
First of all, i can not find my cache? As i remember it was in Computer > Q: Drive > .(whatever your server is) Another one of my questions is how to change the armour tab. I'll post a picture. [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/9/helpmrc.jpg/][IMG]http://img9.imageshack.us/img9/3254/helpmrc.jpg[/img][/URL] I want to know how to change the "attack bouns and def bonus" to icons, like price check, stats, and others. Last question, i am wearing nulls, and cannot remove them. How would i go about fixing this? Please Help.:) Thank you!

item.title: Starting New Project Help:)
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

For the nulls you have to add the models to your client.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting New Project Help:)
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

nickog15:

Well if this is not a “clean” server can you provide me one or point me to a fourm post with a good clean one.

A clean server, in my opinion, is the base. Use the stock runesource, hyperion, apollo, shard, and if you must insist on wL use the crash-patched one by blakeman. My personal preference is runesource. If you are looking for a server with more content then what the nearly blank runesource has to offer check out the Azure derivatives provided by BFMV.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting New Project Help:)
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

Well if this is not a “clean” server can you provide me one or point me to a fourm post with a good clean one.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting New Project Help:)
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

From looking at the pictures I can tell that’s anything but clean. Also, why did you pick a client with that awful gameframe…?

The caches location can be found by checking your findcachedir() method.

Tom’s cache suite to modify the contents of your cache and then use Lin’s interface editor to actually edit the interfaces. Once you’re happy with the result re-pack 'em.

Find out what the starter Id’s are, my guess is that they’re some newer revision item but the client you chose doesn’t support them, so they’re nulls. You can’t remove them because they’re technically not there, in a way.

Read full topic
